text:
It would be great if the HTTP Proxy were able to see if the container where it
is recording contains an HTTP Defaults config object, and avoid storing its own
values in the samplers if they match the defaults.

In this way it would be very easy to record a script against one server and run
it against another one, which is a very common operation.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
mstover1@apache.org
text:
Yes, it used to do this, but I think I turned it off at some point recently to
debug.  I've turned it back on.

A further enhancement would be to make the proxy check all user-defined
variables and replace any instances in the recorded samples.  That would be a
far more powerful way to do it, as it would fix the values in the Header Manager
as well.
